title: Cannot Reinstall a Gmail Account "Unable to Log in at Server"
creator: barbnjohn
content: Several days ago we inadvertently deleted batches of emails from our two Thunderbird Gmail accounts on our PC and Apple devices. The lost emails were duly recovered but only after having to change my Google password. However one of our Thunderbird Gmail account will not download any new messages coming in. Ultimately we deleted that account from Thunderbird, intending to reinstall it. We deleted the account by pressing the Red button in account settings. We confirmed that messages are received to Gmail's Web page Inbox Now when I attempt to reinstall the account and press Add Account, I get the UNABLE TO LOG IN AT SERVER MESSAGE shown below. The "Your Full Name" I am putting in is the name on the Google account deleted from Thunderbird, and the password I have tried is my new Google password. I have tried the process of not adding in the password until requested to do so but this did not work either. Any suggestions please?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Setting everything comptely on a different drive, including C:\Users\<user>\AppData
creator: JJM
content:
Is there anyway of completely installing Thunberbird on a different drive and not have any stuff including symlinks in the users home directory?

Installing Thunderbird on a different drive/location is documented and straight forward but it insists on putting stuff in the users home directory C:\Users\<user>\AppData\ .

The problem can be fixed by using copying everything Thunderbird related in the C:\Users\<user>\AppData\ to the other drive and use symlinks from C:\Users\<user>\AppData\ directory to its new location. Thunderbird seems to be ok with symlinks.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;ff_version:147.0;os:Windows 10

title: I can receive but cannot send emails
creator: osborne13
content: Hello, I've been happily using Thunderbird for a few years now. Since yesterday, I have been unable to send emails in Thunderbird, but I can receive them. I can send emails directly through my Skymesh Webmail, but in Thunderbird when I try to send an email, I get the following notification, even if I am sending it to only one recipient. Sending of the message failed. The message was not sent due to exceeding the allowed number of recipients. The server responded: Insufficient system storage. Please help. Regards, Judy Osborne 15th January 2026 [edited from public] @bordernet.com.au

title: Thunderbird does not display new emails
creator: michalkubicek10
content:
It seems that after updating to the latest version, Thunderbird is not displaying new emails. The numbers of new emails in the folders are changing, but the emails are not loading. I performed maintenance on the folder, but the emails disappeared and I no longer have any emails in my Inbox. I use IMAP, everything is OK on my phone and on the web. This is happening with Thunderbird at home and at work.

title: Thunderbird calendar
creator: firefox@vangelder.nl
content: It is impossible to edit a calendar item. My calenbar is synchronized with Synology calendar. From there it is synchronized with a number of smartphones, tablets and Windows pc's. Everything performs OK. On my tablets, ohones and pc's I can add and delete items and after automatic synchronization the new data are also onthe the other equipmwent. But editing an appointment performs well on the tablets and phones, but not on the pc's When I edit an appointment on a pc and click "opslaan en sluiten"or "opslaan" the apointment keeps blue, but nothing is changed. Please give me the solution. E-mail works well (via Imap) as contacts, but calendar not. The problem is not the access into the calendar on the synology server, sine I can add and delete appointments. Only editing of an existing appointmen fails.

title: "Retrieval using the IMAP4 protocol failed" on Outlook + S/MIME
creator: sollericos
content:
Environment:

  • Slackware 15 current
  • TB 140.6.0esr
  • M365 account configured via IMAP4 (SSL/TLS & OAuth2)

I can receive & send messages without any problem but can't read those that are signed via S/MIME. The message shown is:

> From: Microsoft Exchange Server > Subject: Retrieval using the IMAP4 protocol failed for the following message: xxxxxxx > Body: > The server couldn't retrieve the following message: > > Subject: "Re: Invoice from XXXXXXXXX" > From: "John Smith" ("/O=EXCHANGELABS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (GGGGGGGGG)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=USERxxxxxxx") > Sent date: 1/8/2026 9:39:47 AM > > The message hasn't been deleted. You might be able to view it using either Outlook or Outlook Web App. You can also contact the sender to find out what the message says.

So I can read them via OWA but I prefer TB.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0;os:Linux - Slackware 15 current

title: Nezobrazují se příchozí emaily
creator: karel.kozel
content: Dobrý den, nově příchozí emaily se mi zobrazí pouze číslovkou Doručená pošta (6), ale jednotlivé nové emaily se nenačtou. Pokud tyto nově příchozí emaily u poskytovatel emailu (centrum.cz) přesunu do nové složky ABC viz 01.png, opět se jejich počet zobrazí ABC (6), ale jednotlivé emaily se mi ve složce ABC opět nezobrazí a skložka v Mozzila Thunderbird se tváří jako prázdní viz 02.png i když prázdná není. Restart Thunderbirdu a Windows nepomohl. Prosím o radu. Děkuji, Karel

title: wijzigen afspraak in agenda mislukt
creator: firefox@vangelder.nl
content:
Ik heb op mijn Synology NAS een agenda. Die synchroniseert met Android telefoons, Android tablets en windows pc's. Toevoegen en verwijderen van afspraken werkt prima op alle apparaten. Maar wijzigen van een afspraak kan alleen op de telefoons an tablet. Als je een afspraak in Thunderbird agenda op een Windows pc opent, aanpassingen aanbrengt en klikt op "opslaan en sluiten" of op "opslaan" wordt de wijziging niet opgeslagen. Het ligt niet aan de koppeling met de server, want als die niet goed zou werken zou je ook geen nieuwe kunnen maken en een bestaande niet kunnen verwijderen en zouden de aanpassingen die je maakt op een tablet of telefoon ook niet zichtbaar worden in de thunderbird agenda.

Weet iemand een oplossing?

title: Problem moving messages between folders
creator: Jim829
content:
Currently using Thunderbird 147.0 (64 bit)

What I want to do is move messages between folders and subfolders without triggering automatic downloads. In this case, I want the folders to be local only and not saved on the server.

When I moved messages as described, they first seem like they are moving okay. My target folder shows the correct number and the source folder appears empty. Then, the messages re-appear in the source folder. The target folder still shows all the messages but if I repair it to ensure it is okay, it gets reduced. Only some of the messages are moved. No warnings are given that repairing it would cause a problem. Since this is a local action would I would expect it to be relatively quick. This also triggers a download from the server to the source folder every time something is moved.

I have tried changing synchronization options to offline but that doesn't have any effect. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated, along with the explanation of what may be causing this behavior.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 11

title: Earthlink/Thunderbird/Zianet Email Messaging Disconnect
creator: jeanfulton
content:
Hello:

I am unable to send email messages to any "@zianet.com" email accounts (New Mexico). I can receive Zianet email messages, but I cannot Send or Reply. Zianet says they recognize the Earthlink IP Address, but that there is a third sender's IP Address they don't recognize. Earthlink says they have given Zianet the IP addresses. Does Mozilla Thunderbird have a third IP Address I can share with Zianet Tech Support? Zianet's phone number here in Las Cruces, New Mexico is: 1.575.353.1234. This issue is causing a lot of problems for me and my business. Thank you so much.

Here is the error message:

Delivery has failed to these recipients or distribution lists:

title: Not getting new messages
creator: jkerman
content:
Around Jan. 4, I tried moving all of my Inbox contents to a new subfolder "Inbox 2025". This process was taking a long time and I didn't see it complete. Afterwards, I can start Thunderbird OK (version 115.3.1 (64-bit) running on a Windows 10 system). I see the new folder "Inbox 2025" and it seems complete. I also see other folders which look OK. But the incoming messages have frozen at 01/01/26 [for one e-mail account] and at 01/04/26 [for a second e-mail account.]

It is also true that all of my Thunderbird sessions end by crashing after a certain period of time. What can I do to restart Thunderbird so that it will connect with the relevant servers, get new messages and not crash?

title: Thunderbird 147 vs. Outlook Office 365 Exchange account
creator: ippk.ic
content:
Hello,

I don't know if I should write in English or not, but I will write in both languages. I have a long-standing problem. So far I have been working with messages on a server that only supports IMAP and SMTP. Hundreds of messages a year. After years we migrated to Outlook office 365 Exchange and TB 128-13x only worked with DavMail! When writing a long message it was ok, but when writing a long reply the forwarding symbol disappeared from the messages. I was happy to hear that version 145 can directly use Exchange with Oauth2 authentication.

But disappointment came quickly. I transferred my profile backup to TB145. It works fine offline. I can see the folders and the original emails. 1) A newly created email in Office365 is synchronized to TB. If it is a forwarded message or a reply, the message is synchronized to TB again without the reply/forward symbol. I don't recognize that I responded to the situation! 2) If I perform a "Repair Folder" in TB to improve the status, it is repaired by loading messages from the mail server so that every forwarding/reply symbol disappears in TB. 3) If I have the original backup email in TB and copy it to another folder, an exact copy is created, and the reply symbol is also visible in TB. However, in Outlook, the symbol is missing from this copy.

4) to make everything as it should be, I have to start the message again in TB(145) so that the symbols are visible everywhere.

I am interested in solving points 1,2,3, because I have several communication projects where I still follow up in messages, so I need the symbols.

Thank you.

Dobrý den,

nevím zda mám psát anglicky nebo ne, ale napíšu obojím jazykem. Mám dlouhodobý problém. Doposud jsem pracoval se zprávami na serveru podporující pouze IMAP a SMTP. Stovky zpráv ročně. Po letech jsme migrovali na Outlook office 365 Echange a TB 128-13x fungoval jen pomocí DavMail ! Při dlouhém psaní zprávy ok, při dlouhém psaní odpovědi ale ze zpráv mizel symbol přeposlání. Radost přišla s oznámením, že verze 145 umí přímo Echange s atentizací Oauth2.

Rychle ale přišlo zklamání. Svoji zálohu profilu jsem přenesl do TB145. Offline pracuje dobře. Vidím složky a původní maily. 1) Nově vytvořený email v Office365 se synchronizuje do TB. Pokud jde o zprávu přeposlanou nebo odpověď, do TB se zpráva synchronizuje opět bez symbolu odpovědi/přeposlání. Nepoznám, že jsem na situaci reagoval! 2) Pokud v TB pro zlepšení stavu provedu "Opravit složku", opraví se načtením zpráv ze mail serveru tak, že v TB zmizí každý symbol přeposlání/odpovědi. 3) Mám-li původní záložní email v TB a zkopíruji ho do jiné složky, vytvoří se přesná kopie, v TB je vidět i symbol odpovědi. Ovšem v Outlook zase u této kopie symbol chybí.

4) aby vše bylo jak má být, musím zprávu začít znovu v TB(145) aby symboly byly viditelné všude.

Mne zajímá ja kvyřešit bod 1,2,3, protože mám několik komunikačních projektů, kde stále navazuji ve zprávách, tak symboliku potřebuji.

Děkuji.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Win11;kb_visits_prior:["/cs/kb/synchronizace-pres-protokol-imap", "/cs/kb/export-profilu-thunderbirdu", "/en-US/kb/thunderbird-export", "/en-US/kb/thunderbird-import"]

title: Upper Right-hand Corner
creator: Vanessalf
content: In the upper right hand corner there should be a minus sign, restore/down sign and an X. Instead of these I have what looks like an X in a box. It appears to be fixed when I run in Trouble mode. Even the default theme shows it wrong. This just began happening. Thanks to anyone who can help me out.
